item.source: Anyone know how to fix this compiler error

item.title: Anyone know how to fix this compiler error
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“purestmage74, post:2, topic:464549”]inside of:

case 2:
// right here.
break;

Add it after the last ‘}’ right before the ‘break;’ in case 2:

else if (token.equals("summoningnpcid")) { p.summoningnpcid = Integer.parseInt(token2); } // Right Here [/quote]

It doesn’t even show case two in his code, if you don’t know what you’re talking about you shouldn’t really be helping.
On topic, mostly the saves are set up like this:

if (token.equals("1")) {
	p.1= Integer.parseInt(token2);
} else if (token.equals("2")) {
	p.2= Integer.parseInt(token2);
} else if (token.equals("3")) {
	p.3= Integer.parseInt(token2);
}

There is an if statement followed by else-if statements, post the entire code and I’ll help, it’s just a misplacement of the brackets, I’m sure. If statements are usually set up like this:

if() {
     //Stuff Here
} else if() {
     //Stuff Here
} else {
     //Stuff Here
}

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone know how to fix this compiler error
item.dc:creator: @Forsakinpkers Forsakinpkers
item.description:
@Forsakinpkers wrote:

i add this code into my server in playersave and i get this

} else if (token.equals(“slayerPoints”)) {
p.slayerPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2);

and i get this error

src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:67: error: ‘else’ without ‘if’
} else if (token.equals(“slayerPoints”)
{
^
src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:125: error: orphaned case
case 3:
^
2 errors
Press any key to continue . . .
